description: From the Latin centēsimātiō, from centēsimō, from centēsimus (“hundredth”); compare quintation, septimation, decimation, vicesimation, and tricesimation.

entries.meaning: (military history, rare) The selection by lot of every hundredth man (of an army or group of prisoners or mutineers) for execution.
examples: CENTESIMATION, a milder kind of military puniſhment, in caſes of deſertion, mutiny, and the like, when only every hundredth man is executed.
